alert.note: Alert for Nassau (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 29 at 3:57PM EDT until September 29 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHERN NASSAU COUNTY... At 357 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 4 and 6 inches of rain have fallen, with some localized higher amounts up to 7 inches. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 1.5 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Multiple water rescues are ongoing in the warning area, which includes Bellmore and motorists stranded in Rockville Centre. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Levittown, Freeport, Valley Stream, Long Beach, Garden City, Massapequa, Lynbrook, Mineola, Woodmere, Farmingdale, Jones Beach, Hempstead, Hicksville, Elmont, Oceanside, Baldwin, Wantagh, Cedarhurst, Lido Beach and Atlantic Beach. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-1.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other drainage areas and low lying spots. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
